| History                 = Since [[Maxwell Glenn (Earth-616)|Maxwell Glenn]]'s death, Glenn Industries had operated in the red, and were nearly bankrupt.{{r|Daredevil Vol 1 #165}} To keep itself on the budget, their legal department proposed a reorganization of administrative sequence to allow for increased efficiency in the supervision of duties.{{r|Daredevil Vol 1 #182}} The company began dealing with [[Atreus Plastics (Earth-616)|Atreus Plastics]], a manufacturer specialized in explosives.{{r|Daredevil Vol 1 #184}} [[Heather Glenn (Earth-616)|Heather Glenn]] then hired lawyer [[Franklin Nelson (Earth-616)|Franklin Nelson]] to investigate the dealing with Atreus.{{r|Daredevil Vol 1 #185}} Glenn Industries was criminally prosecuted by [[Maxine Lavender (Earth-616)|Maxine Lavender]].{{r|Daredevil Vol 1 #186}}
